intro: Seseli montanum var. peucedanifolium, commonly known as mountain seseli, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like foliage. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clustered umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. This variety is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
